6a443a2e32141daa.title: Revenue Analyst
6a443a2e32141daa.desc:
Summary:   As a Revenue Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing financial data and identifying key trends to maximize revenue for the company. Your role will involve developing and implementing revenue strategies to optimize profitability, as well as providing valuable insights to support decision-making across the organization. Support the CRO and senior management identifying the most critical  issues and actions to be taken to achieve results. If you have a strong analytical mindset and a passion for maximizing revenue growth, then this role could be the perfect fit for you. As a Revenue Analyst, you will have the opportunity to play a critical role in driving the financial success of the company.     Duties / Responsibilities:   
 
 Analyze financial data to identify trends and opportunities for revenue growth 
  Develop and implement revenue strategies to maximize profitability  
 Monitor revenue performance and provide regular reports to senior management 
  Collaborate with other departments to identify cross-selling and up-selling opportunities 
  Develop pricing strategies and conduct pricing analysis to optimize revenue  
 Conduct market research to identify new revenue streams and opportunities  
 Provide support to sales teams to ensure that revenue targets are achieved  
 Utilize various software applications and tools to compile and analyze data  
 Communicate with internal stakeholders to ensure a cohesive approach to revenue management  
 Participate in financial planning and forecasting activities 
  Develop dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate key performance metrics and insights to stakeholders  
 Identify and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and programs. 
  Conduct competitor analysis to identify market trends and opportunities for growth. 
  Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and implement data-driven strategies that improve customer acquisition, retention, and engagement. 
 
  Required Qualifications: 
 
  Bachelor’s degree in Business or a related field 
  2+ years of experience in revenue analysis or a similar role  
 Experience working in a multi-product SAAS/Software company 
  Understanding of financial statements and accounting principles 
  Understanding of financial statements and accounting principles 
  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  
 Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial analysis tools  
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team  
 
 Preferred Qualifications: 
 
  Master’s degree in Business or related field. 
  5+ years of relevant experience. 
  Experience working with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI) as well as Salesforce and Sage Intacct 
  Well-equipped to drive the Company’s growth as the Company continues to increase in scale and complexity.  
 Experience in a middle market business or otherwise highly entrepreneurial to develop, sell, enable and maximize revenue growth. 
 
  Normal Working Hours and Conditions:  Core business hours are generally 8:00 am – 5:00 pm. However, this position will require work to be performed outside of normal business hours based on Company operations.  
 Physical Requirements:  Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting including verbally communicating, seeing and hearing to exchange information and fine coordination including use of a computer keyboard. Daily physical functions include standing, sitting and walking for prolonged periods of time and occasionally stooping, bending, kneeling, crouching, reaching, and twisting. The employee may engage in lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling light to moderate amounts of weight up to 25 pounds. The position also requires the operation of office equipment requiring repetitive hand movement.  
 Navigate360 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other legally protected status.

5f4146a3989f1a0a.title: Business Systems Analyst
5f4146a3989f1a0a.desc:
Availity delivers revenue cycle and related business solutions for health care professionals who want to build healthy, thriving organizations. Availity has the powerful tools, actionable insights and expansive network reach that medical businesses need to get an edge in an industry constantly redefined by change.
  
  Availity is a Healthcare IT company headquartered in Jacksonville, FL, with additional offices in Indianapolis, IN, and Bangalore, India, and a significant remote workforce throughout the US. Availity is the nation’s largest health information network, connecting over 2 million providers with health plans nationwide and processing more than 13 billion transactions a year, and growing! We work collaboratively with health plans and providers to disrupt an antiquated healthcare system by offering solutions that solve core issues in how these stakeholders communicate. Availity also provides revenue cycle management solutions to help providers, hospitals, and health systems receive accurate, timely payment for their services.
  
  As the premier healthcare engagement platform, our mission is to create connections and deliver products that help healthcare businesses succeed. We connect, delight, and empower the nation’s premier healthcare ecosystem, providing multi-stakeholder solutions that simplify the business relationship between providers and health plans.
  
 
   Reporting to the Manager, Applications Development the Business Systems Analyst will work to support our Covered California initiative. This individual will be reviewing data files, performing research and analysis, and becoming fully engrained with our Symphony product. The ideal candidate has a keen eye and attention to detail, is a systemic thinker, and has the ability to deliver results in a deadline-driven environment.
  
 
 
   Sponsorship, in any form, is not available for this position.
  
 
 
   Location: Remote US – Eastern/Central Time Zone
  
 
 
   Why you want to work on this team:
  
 
  This team has a direct impact on shaping Availity’s future in the California market 
  You will have the opportunity to work with other individuals and teams from across the organization to solve complex issues 
 
 
 
   To be qualified for this position:
  
 
  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field 
  7+ years of experience as a Business System Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role 
  Demonstrated excellence in SQL 
  Proficiency in system analysis and modeling techniques 
  Familiarity with agile development methodologies and project management tools 
  Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills, with the ability to understand complex systems and data structures 
  Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders 
  Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment 
 
 
 
   You will set yourself apart:
  
 
  Strong knowledge of healthcare provider data, including data standards, quality, and regulatory requirements 
  Mastery of SQL language 
  In-depth knowledge of AWS services and solutions, including but not limited to EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, CloudFormation, IAM, and CloudWatch 
  AWS certifications, such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect or AWS Certified Developer, are highly desirable but not mandatory 
 
 
 
   You will be:
  
 
  Analyzing and documenting system requirements, data flows, and data structures, ensuring that they align with the overall project goals and comply with industry standards and regulations 
  Translating business requirements into detailed technical specifications for the development team, including functional requirements, data models, and system architectures 
  Leading system testing, validation, and troubleshooting 
  Collaborating with the quality assurance team to identify and resolve issues 
  Communicating with product teams to provide regular updates on project progress and status 
  Developing and maintaining system documentation, including but not limited to, process flows, data dictionaries, and system architecture diagrams 
  Providing guidance and support to other team members as needed, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment 
  Staying current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in the healthcare data and AWS ecosystem to drive continuous improvement and innovation within the team 
  Guiding other members of the organization, including management, technical teams, and end-users, to ensure that business requirements are met, and systems are functioning as intended 
  Training and supporting end-users on new or updated systems, processes, and functionalities 
  Leading system implementation and providing post-implementation support, including issue resolution and system enhancements. 
 
 
 
   Availity culture and benefits:
  
 
  Availity is a certified “Great Place to Work”! Culture is important to us and there are many ways for you to make your mark here! 
  We have several Diversity & Inclusion teams, a Young Professionals Group, a She Can Code IT group for women in tech, and various ways to engage with fellow Availity associates. 
  Availity is a culture of continuous learning. We have many resources and experts in our tech stack and in our industry that can help get you there too! 
  Don’t feel like wearing business attire? Cool, you can wear jeans – we are a casual place. 
  Availity offers a robust total rewards package that is competitive and meaningful. We offer a competitive salary and bonus structure. We offer two different types of medical plans: a HDHP plan that has the lowest permitted deductible allowed by the IRS with a generous HSA company contribution and a PPO plan with a low deductible and out of pocket maximum. In addition, Availity offers two dental plans including orthodontia care (even for adults), vision, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), pet care, legal/ID shield services and a 401k match program that you can take advantage of on day one! 
  We offer unlimited PTO for salaried associates + 9 paid holidays. Hourly associates start at 19 days of PTO and go up from there with all the same holiday benefits. 
  Interested in wellness? We allow our associates to reimburse up to $250/year for gym memberships, participation in racing events, weight management programs, etc. 
  Interested in furthering your education? We offer education reimbursement! 
  Availity offers Paid Parental Leave for both moms and dads, both birth parents and adoptive parents. 
  Want to work for an organization that gives back to the community? You’re at the right place! Availity partners with various organizations, both locally and nationally, to raise awareness, funds and morale as our staff members volunteer their time and funds to engage the organizations campaign. Each associate has 1 paid day per year to volunteer at the non-profit charity of your choice. 
 
 
 
   Availity perks for remote, hybrid and office-based associates:
  
 
  We offer a flexible working environment! Whether you are a fully remote associate or one that enjoys a hybrid or fully onsite approach we are flexible to help ensure you have a working environment to thrive in! 
  Don’t feel like going too far to eat? We occasionally have food trucks at our Jacksonville Office as well as food available for purchase in our cafe and an onsite café next to our Indianapolis office 
  We also have onsite Fitness Centers with showers for our Jacksonville & Indianapolis offices and an annual Wellness reimbursement you can use for a gym membership, classes, sports activities, etc. 
  We appreciate work/life balance! Need to get a quick break in between meetings? We offer online Yoga, virtual total body condition classes, step challenges, and health and wellness courses and in our Jacksonville office, we have Ping Pong, Foosball, Arcade games, and XBox to help you decompress – and we have a massage therapist onsite once a week for a little relaxation too 
  We’ve got you covered with free coffee, lemonade and tea anytime you want in Jacksonville 
 
 
 
   Next steps:
  
 
   After you apply, you will receive text/email messages thanking you for applying and then you will continue to receive more text/email messages alerting you as to where you are in the recruitment process.
  
 
 
   Interview process:
  
 
  Recruiter resume review 
  Manager resume review 
  Recruiter phone screen 
  Manager video interview 
  Panel video interview 
 
 
 
  Availity is an equal opportunity employer and makes decisions in employment matters without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances. 
 
 
 
  Availity is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. 
 
 
 
  NOTICE: Federal law requires all employers to verify the identity and employment eligibility of all persons hired to work in the United States. When required by state law or federal regulation, Availity uses I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification in conjunction with E-Verify to determine employment eligibility. Learn more about E-Verify at  
 
 http://www.dhs.gov/e-verify 
 
 .

f601832f8364e3df.title: Senior Business Analyst
f601832f8364e3df.desc:
Overview: 
  
   REI Systems’ mission is to deliver innovative technology solutions for Federal Clients. The foundation of our success is an unwavering determination to surpass our client’s expectations. We offer this same commitment to our employees by providing professional development, projects that are impactful and meaningful, and the flexibility to spend time with family and friends. We believe our employees are at their best when they are fulfilled in both their professional careers and their lives outside of work. Learn more at REIsystems.com.
  
 
 
  Employees voted REI Systems a Washington Post Top Workplace in 2015, 2016, 2018, 2020, 2021 and 2022!
   Responsibilities: 
  
  Specific Roles and Responsibilities for the Business Analyst position include but are not limited to: 
 
 
  Collaborate closely with product, program, and policy owners to elicit and understand their business needs, define requirements, write user stories, manage a product backlog, and analyze business requirements. 
  Facilitate effective communication and coordination between upstream and downstream teams to ensure smooth workflow and timely delivery. 
  Present findings, recommendations, and solutions to clients and cross-dependent teams in a clear and concise manner. 
  Identify and understand customer expectations as part of the requirements gathering process and act as the primary point of contact for all communication needs during the requirements gathering phase with the customer 
  Provide ongoing support to resolve any issues or questions that arise during the project lifecycle 
  Study existing business processes, programs, and/or legacy systems in their native environments and perform a comprehensive analysis of existing problems and understand the areas for improvement 
  Making sure solutions are of high quality, meeting business and operational performance indicators and delivering great customer experience 
  Lead the creation of UAT documentation (scripts, recording documents) and help coordinate the UAT process and any subsequent bug fixes prior to approval and roll out 
  Facilitate reconciliation of differences voiced by the customer with those in the system proposal, reducing scope creep or impacts to the delivered system’s quality 
  Collaborate with developers and testers by developing test scenarios based on behavior-driven development (BDD) principles 
  Managing requirements traceability information and changes through effective change control processes and tools 
  Prepare project documentation like meeting minutes, business process documents and other process workflow diagrams as required. 
  Ensure that previous customer program decisions are reviewed and that new ones are recorded with the stakeholder participating to maintain program focus of extended efforts and continuity if customer or company personnel changes occur. 
  All interested applicants will be required to provide artifacts – requirements documentation from previous project(s) that may include user stories, user requirements, business process documents, UAT scenarios, etc. 
  Provide insightful narrative and updates to project/program managers for progress reporting and board updates. 
  Support any relevant procurement activities (RFP/RFI/ROM processes) and work with relevant solutions team(s) to communicate requirements and clarify overall understanding of the functionality. 
  Qualifications: 
  
  Business Analyst will have the following qualifications: 
 
 
  6+ years of experience working with an Agile implementation team writing user stories, grooming product backlog, planning out release planning. 
  Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders. 
  Experience with coordinating activities between upstream and downstream teams. 
  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present solutions to clients and cross-dependent teams. 
  Possesses a strong attention to detail and the ability to maintain accuracy while working in a fast-paced environment. 
  Experience with the full software development lifecycle of Agile IT projects 
  Hands-on experience with JIRA, MS Office, especially Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint 
  Proven experience as a Business Analyst, specifically working on back-end services projects. 
 
 
 
  Education:  Bachelor's degree in business and management, information systems, computer science, or other related field
  
 
  Certifications:  SAFe Agile and Scrum Master certified preferred
  
 
  Clearance:  Eligible to obtain a public trust clearance
  
 
  Location:  Hybrid, Sterling VA office.
  
 
 
 
 
  REI Systems is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minority/Female/Disability/Vet)

7da8d4af79fc9a73.title: IT Business Analyst, Production - CONSULTANT
7da8d4af79fc9a73.desc:
CHEERS!  Founded in 1981, Deutsch Family Wine and Spirits markets quality wines produced by prestigious families from major wine regions of the world. With our headquarters in Stamford, CT, DFWS is the 4th largest wine company with one of the fastest growing spirits portfolios. With our family values and unique culture, DFWS was recognized as one of the Top Workplaces in the U.S. in 2022 and 2023. 
  Deutsch Family Wine & Spirits currently seeks a Production Business Analyst CONSULTANT to join the team. This is a remote role that can be based anywhere in the US. The ideal Production business analyst will not just sit idly and gather requirements but will instead ask meaningful questions and ensure all angles of a problem are scrutinized. They will work closely within a cross-functional team and strive to balance scope and schedule. A great analyst will compel their audience with well-articulated issues and solutions backed up with data. They will support the overall design, plan, and execution of all Production-related initiatives. 
   
 Responsibilities 
 
  Support the end-to-end Production process and systems design across our ERP (JDE) and supporting applications (Crafted by NetSuite, InnoVint, Cognos). 
  Owns the Production solutions from a hands-on configuration and functional perspective and governs all changes (break-fix and minor enhancements) 
  Works closely with business users on how best to use the systems to perform daily functions and Identify project requirements through interviews, workshops, operations analysis, and best practices research. 
  Work with stakeholders to prioritize collected requirements based on risk, benefit, and scope 
  Documents requirements to detail application requirements, solution design, adherence to best practice, and metrics 
  Documents functional specifications when required to support enhancement work 
  Bridges between the business team and the development team to ensure functional requirements are understood and ensure development requirements integrated across all applicable systems 
  Performs unit testing of proposed changes and supports user testing, implementation, training, and support 
  Provide insightful operational analysis based on a predetermined metrics (KPIs)  
 Prepare reports to be reviewed by leadership teams 
  Utilize strong analytical abilities to identify root causes of business issues 
  Assist the Operations Solutions Director and ERP Manager on departmental strategy 
  Project Manager for applicable initiative utilizing Project Management Methodology 
  Work independently and manage multiple task assignments 
 
 
  Basic Qualifications 
 
  7+ years of experience working with ERP Systems (NetSuite preferred or JDE’s EnterpriseOnev9.0or higher).  
 Strong working knowledge of Production/Manufacturing, Order-to-Cash and Purchase-to-Pay processes. 
  Foundational understanding of General Accounting, Inventory Costing, Supply Chain and EDI. 
  Be flexible in an evolving environment  
 Dedicated team player that takes initiative 
  Exceptional communication skills with ability to present to Senior Management 
  Able to work with diverse, cross-functional teams 
  Possess strong problem-solving mastery, attention to detail, and organizational skills 
  Contribute to help build and execute the strategic vision of the department 
  Experienced with Spirits or Winemaking software 
  BA/BS required (preferably in Manufacturing or Supply Chain) 
 
 
  Preferred Qualifications 
 
  PMP certified or project management experience 
  Food and Beverage / Alcohol experience  
 Consulting experience 
  End-user training experience 
 
 
  We Value Diversity 
  DFWS is committed to inclusion and diversity. We cultivate a work environment that celebrates diversity because differences continue to make the company culture stronger, enhance our connection with the communities we serve and strengthen our competitive advantage. Building an inclusive culture continues to be at the core of all we do. 
 
  About Deutsch Family Wine & Spirits  
 Initially called W.J. Deutsch & Sons Ltd., the company was founded in 1981 by Chairman Bill Deutsch to market quality wines produced by prestigious families from major wine regions of the world. In 2009, it announced the expansion of the award-winning company to include a Spirits Portfolio. Today the company is renowned for its brand-building prowess and its ability to meet the needs of the modern consumer. Bill's son Peter Deutsch is CEO; thus two generations of the Deutsch family work side by side in their continuous quest to build strong brands and relationships throughout the wine and spirits industry. 
 
  The portfolio includes award-winning wines from Australia: [ yellow tail ], [ yellow tail ] Pure Bright, [ yellow tail ] Fresh Twist; California: Girard Winery, Joseph Carr, Josh Cellars, Josh Cellars Reserve, Layer Cake, The Calling; France: Beau Joie Champagne, Cave de Lugny, Fleurs de Prairie, Hob Nob Vineyards, Sauvion et Fils; Italy: Barone Fini, Villa Pozzi; New Zealand: The Crossings; Portugal: Quinta Do Vale Meao; Argentina: Clos de los Siete; and award-winning spirits: Redemption Whiskey, Bib & Tucker Bourbon, Masterson's Rye, Gray Whale Gin, Luksusowa Vodka and Cantera Negra Tequila. 
  Learn more about Deutsch Family Wine & Spirits at www.deutschfamily.com 
  Deutsch Family Wine and Spirits is an Equal Opportunity Employer

13fb649da534032d.title: Technical Writer/Business Analyst
13fb649da534032d.desc:
Your Impact: 
  Jacobs is seeking a highly motivated team member to fill the Business Analyst/Technical Writer role on our Documentation Team. The Documentation Team is an independent group that creates and maintains security processes and procedures for a Federal client. 
 As such, the team is tasked to manage the revision lifecycle of the documentation library, and maintain cybersecurity documents to ensure compliance with Federal policy and guidance set forth by Senior Leaders. 
 Candidates are expected to have a strong work ethic and possess the ability to work as a critical member of a team in pursuit of mission objectives and in support of our customer. We value detail-oriented candidates who can quickly respond to emerging tasks. To be successful in this role, you’ll be able to rapidly adapt to client demands and business processes. 
 
 
 The client is located in Washington, DC, but this work is 100% remote. 
   
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Provide analysis of both Cyber and Technical-related documentation of complex technology systems and their related compliance with government and agency policies and procedures. 
 Collaborate with government staff, technical staff, and project technical writers to ensure the highest professional degree of operational and user documentation is delivered to the customer. 
 Facilitate Kickoff Meetings (Annual Reviews) for documentation updates with a detailed agenda, recommended changes, and possible consolidation or retirement of documents. 
 Review and update complex system operational and user documentation. 
 Ensure all documentation, from whitepapers to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), are of the highest professional quality and ready for client distribution to technical and executive management. 
 Create, revise, and publish cybersecurity documentation on the client’s documentation library. 
 Manage and maintain a documentation schedule for assigned documents to track revision cycles and frequency. 
 Maintain a library of possible sources of updates and crosswalk with current security library to ensure compliance with new/existing Federal and Departmental policy. 
 Provide monthly documentation updates associated with new procedures, processes, policies, or other security related issues. 
 Maintain metrics associated with documentation updates, approval rates, timeliness, etc. 
 Provide monthly updates on upcoming revisions, overdue revisions, emergency updates, and trend statistics. 
 Create a variety of memos, reports, job aids, and/or checklists/forms for a wide range of uses. 
 Create/Edit visual graphics, including workflow diagrams, swim lane diagrams, charts, and/or briefings/presentations. 
 Manage, track, and follow-up on multiple documents (which vary in size, from 10 pages to hundreds of pages) simultaneously and create new documents as requested. 
 Support the development of all types of documents and reports by developing and updating written presentations to improve the quality and enhance the usability of these documents. 
 Produce visualizations (such as dashboard, charts, or graphs) that provide insights into process-improvements. 
 
   
 
 Here’s What You’ll Need: 
  Here’s What You’ll Need:  
 
 Must be able to obtain a High Risk/Public Trust Security Clearance 
 Must have good communication skills, both oral and written, and working familiarity with document editing, visual editing, and publishing tools 
 Bachelor’s degree 
 3-5 years in a Technical Writer role supporting technology projects and programs for Federal Government 
 Experience using graphics software (e.g., Microsoft Visio, Adobe Acrobat, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, etc.) 
 Strong working knowledge with MS Office Suite (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and SharePoint) 
 Strong English grammar, proofreading, copyediting skills, and familiarity with style guides 
 Ability to translate technical information to clear, readable documents to be used by technical and non-technical personnel 
 Ability to work in a team environment 
 Ability to manage multiple tasks under tight deadlines 
 Familiarity of the Federal Plain Language Act of 2010 
 
 
 
 Preferred:   
 
 Experience documenting technical enterprise software/systems implementations in a cloud-based operational environment 
 Experience creating Standard Operating Procedures, user manuals, job aids, and technical guides 
 Experience briefing senior-level stakeholders and/or managers 
 Proficient understanding of NIST Special Publications (e.g., SP 800-53, SP 800-137, SP 800-171, and SP 800-37). 
 Proficient understanding and application of the NIST Risk Management Framework (RMF). 
 
 
 
 Typical salary range for this position is  75,000 to 90,000  and is commensurate with experience relative to the position. 
   
 
 #divergent  #dvstis

b705e0d93cc3e116.title: HEALTHCARE INFORMATION SECURITY ANALYST, SR
b705e0d93cc3e116.desc:
HEALTHCARE INFORMATION SECURITY ANALYST, SR 
 
 23003369 
 
 
 
  Job 
 :  Information Technology
  
 
  Primary Location 
 :  Columbia
  
 
  Schedule 
 :  Full-time
  
 
  Shift 
 :  Day Job
  
 
  Unposting Date 
 :  Ongoing
  
 
  Description 
 
  Shift:  Monday – Friday, 8:00AM – 5:00PM 
  Location:  Remote (Missouri Preferred) 
  Department:  IT Administration 
  Salary Range:  $78,520 - $127,962 
  Job Summary: 
  Responsible for assisting in the development, implementation, and monitoring of tools and processes that protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all MU Health information technology (IT) systems and infrastructure. Maintain compliance with all relevant laws and policies. Perform complex and non-routine specialized security analysis functions and advanced analysis. 
  Job Description: 
  Work within the framework of established security and compliance policies and procedures. 
  Develop and maintain information security policies, procedures, and standards, to ensure they meet regulatory compliance and are aligned with industry best practice. Ensure compliance with relevant information security policies, laws, and standards. Identify areas for improvement and work to implement necessary changes. Develop and deliver information security and HIPAA compliance training to all MU Health employees. Administer tailored security training to business owners, data owners, application administrators, and technical staff. 
  Coordinate and conduct vulnerability scans of MU Health Information Systems, including vendors. Analyze data and identify solutions for vulnerability remediation. 
  Maintain informed awareness of security compromises through all stages; means of entry, effects on systems, plan for prevention, and preparation for recovery. Maintain risk register to track current and emerging risks. Perform risk assessments as part of the MU Health risk management lifecycle on current, critical MU Health information systems, identifying gaps and maintaining updates to the MU Health Information Security Corrective Action Plans. Maintain vendor, solution, and data inventories. Audit and maintain documentation related to evaluations, assessments, and remediation. 
  Coordinate and test against adopted security control framework on MU Health information systems, identifying gaps and documenting corrective actions until control-failures are mitigated. 
  May complete unit/department specific duties as outlined in department documents. 
  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES 
  Knowledge of healthcare information and systems. 
  Knowledge of the HIPAA Security Rule. 
  Understanding of information security practices for the network, servers, databases, applications, and advanced use of information security assessment and risk management techniques. 
  Experience in vulnerability management. 
  Experience monitoring data loss and prevention solutions. 
  Experience in IT auditing or IT risk governance/ compliance. 
 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications 
 
  Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, information security, or related area, or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities can be acquired. 
  Five (5) years of experience in information technology, or two (2) years of experience in information security. 
  One of the following certifications within one (1) year as a condition of continued employment in this job classification: 
 
 -Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) by ISC2 
 
 
 -Health Care Information Systems Security and Privacy Practitioner (HCISPP) by ISC2 
 
 
 -Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) by ISACA 
 
 
 -or equivalent certification. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  We value the uniqueness of every individual and strive to ensure each person’s success. Contributions from individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives promote intellectual pluralism and enable us to achieve the excellence that we seek in learning, research and engagement. This commitment makes our university a better place to work, learn and innovate.

9d7738de382b92b1.title: Senior Program Analyst - Remote
9d7738de382b92b1.desc:
Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) is currently seeking a qualified and motivated candidate for the position of Program Analyst.
   
 
 
  Labor Category:  Senior Program Analyst - Remote
   
 
 
   Successful performance of a Program Analyst under this requirement requires a wide variety of associated duties including research, analysis, systems thinking, data entry, writing, document preparation, editing, scanning, document management, copying, phone calls, faxing, filing, and other activities as necessary to complete the tasks assigned. Contractor Personnel are required to provide data input/extraction and ongoing support of the data systems for VHA Procurement Regional Procurement Offices (RPOs) and Network/Program Contracting Activity. Program Analysts may also be expected to analyze a wide variety of data from conceptualization through presentation of the data to the RPO Program Analyst team.
   
 
 
  Responsibilities: 
 
 
 
  Assists in designing, coordinating, developing, and documenting proposed organization designs, and/or changes in business/programmatic processes, procedures, and/or products. 
  Performs initial reviews of existing processes, procedures, and/or products. 
  Gathers and compiles data for reports to develop comprehensive studies for decision-making purposes and ensures information is provided within necessary time frames. 
  Organizes and analyzes data from all applicable sources, using statistical methods to ensure the validity of results. 
  Assists in the development of recommendations for changes to improve systems, applications, processes, or products. 
  Provides data and trend analysis during exploratory and informative stages. 
  Briefs RPO Program Analysts on problem areas, corrective action to be taken, and the monitoring of those actions once implemented. 
  Responds to all customer inquiries and concerns and recommends alternate approaches when customers' request cannot be met. 
 
 
  Qualifications: 
 
 
 
  Work Experience:  A minimum of eight (8) recent years of relevant experience in conducting comprehensive program analyst services
   
 
 Education:  Program Analysts shall have, at a minimum, a relevant bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university.
  
 
  Additional Knowledge and Skills:  In addition to the experience and educational requirements described above, Program Analysts shall clearly possess the following knowledge and skills:
   
 
 
  Working knowledge of PC software packages, such as Microsoft Power BI, Power Automate, Excel, Access, SharePoint, various Microsoft programs, and other Business Intelligence software. 
  Experience with established program analysis principles, theories, and practices, including knowledge of various analytical techniques (audits, databases, spreadsheet/graphics analysis) 
  Working knowledge of qualitative and/or quantitative data analytic methods for the assessment and suggested improvements of program effectiveness. 
 
 
  Electronic Media: 
  All contractor employees shall be knowledgeable and proficient in the use of Microsoft Office basic tools and software: Word, Excel, Outlook, Share Points. It is mandatory that all contract employees be proficient with modern computing equipment.
   
 
 English Language Requirement: 
  The Contractor shall ensure all personnel are able to read, write, and speak English well enough to effectively communicate.
   U.S. Citizenship:  
  All contractor personnel performing under this contract shall be U.S. citizens.
   
 Place of Performance: 
 
 
   This requirement requires contractor personnel to work off-site (remote). Travel to the nearest VA Medical Center is required for on-boarding (fingerprinting, PIV picture, PIV card and GFE). Contractor personnel are usually required to physically access the nearest VA facility when receiving GFE.
  
 
  Jamison Corporate Overview: 
 
 
 
   Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (Jamison) is a Service-Disabled, Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), certified Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) headquartered in metropolitan Atlanta, Georgia. We specialize in providing professional management, administrative, healthcare, court reporters and transcriptionist experts, and document/ record and telehealth operational support solutions to U.S. Government, State and commercial clients. Jamison is a nationwide professional staff augmentation company, that helps commercial clients and government agencies expand their talent acquisition reach by sourcing, assessing, developing, and managing the talent that enables them to be successful.
   
 
 
   Jamison offers a wide range of employment opportunities in the commercial and government sectors. We seek employees who share our values of service excellence, integrity, and professionalism.
   
 
 
   Jamison affords equal employment opportunity to all individuals, regardless of race, creed, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Our employees, as well as applicants and others with whom we do business, will not be subjected to sexual, racial, religious, ethnic, or any other form of unlawful harassment and/or discrimination. In addition, JPS adheres to the equal employment opportunity requirements of all states and localities in which it does business.
   
 
 
   Jamison’s commitment to equal opportunity is applied through every aspect of the employment relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, placement, training, compensation, promotion, transfer, termination, and all other matters of employment.
   
 
 
   Applicants may be required to successfully complete an online assessment to determine qualifications for positions requiring specific skills.
   
 
 
   All applications must be submitted through our application system at: https://www.jps-online.com/apply-now/
  
 
 
 About Jamison Professional Services Inc: 
 
 
 Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (Jamison) is a Service-Disabled, Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), certified Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) headquartered in metropolitan Atlanta, Georgia, founded in 1993. As a nationwide professional staff augmentation company, we help commercial clients and government agencies expand their talent acquisition reach by sourcing, assessing, developing, and managing the talent that enables them to be successful. We have provided talent solutions and operational solutions in the areas of program management, financial management, acquisition support, and strategic planning/consulting to over 30 U.S. Government agencies, including all four branches of the military.

29c1c0b33b56a748.desc:
Business Analyst, Project Coordinator & Writer 
 Hybrid - Remote 
 Overview 
 We are a modern management consulting firm focused on human experience, digital services, and business transformation. We help clients drive change to arrive at their new tomorrow. We plan and execute transformation programs through integration, technology enablement, restructuring and capability building. We serve clients in a wide range of industries. 
 Our work inspires. Our clients include the fortune 500, entrepreneurs, and nonprofits who've set out to change their world. Join us and be part of a team transforming how work is done. 
 Location 
 Remote 
 Job Description 
 The Business Analyst, Project Coordinator & Writer will be responsible for executing a diverse range of responsibilities within the scope of creating, organizing, developing, and producing client deliverables, communications, developing templates, instruction guides and other formally requested client correspondences. You will be working directly with Senior Management in an array of duties. We require a candidate with the motivation to succeed and a passion to excel. The candidate must be capable of rising to the challenge of working for a distinguished organization that serves national clients. As a start-up company, we expect our team to be willing to learn to accomplish their work with the highest operational excellence. You will work internally and externally with clients and vendors, so it is imperative to always demonstrate the highest level of professionalism. 
 To be successful in this role, you will need excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, strong interpersonal skills, service orientation, and demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks, complexity and ambiguity, and be proactive in managing issues and risks associated with assigned work. Candidates with experience change management and/or supporting or leading efforts at fortune 500 or top-tier consulting firms are strongly encouraged to apply. 
 Duties and Responsibilities 
 
 Develop deliverables, tools, templates by assembling information, developing outlines, writing, revising, and editing drafts including executive summaries, and conclusions 
 Support principals in execution of project milestones, monitor and track deliverables and timelines. 
 Develop reporting and documentation, maintain spreadsheets and track metrics 
 Support principals in relation to change management plans including development of communication deliverables, stakeholder management, resistance management and impact analysis 
 Serve as primary point of contact to coordinate and project manage the various activities and tasks to ensure work is completed on time 
 Assist with the development of deliverables, and presentations, ensuring all project documentation is maintained and up to date 
 Analyze and effectively present data to generate insights or inform strategy, metrics and path forward 
 Perform data collection and administrative tasks, including partners, outlining requirements, and organizing and distributing information 
 Manage executive calendar, coordinate meetings, research and compile information from a variety of internal and external databases, update presentations and TEAMS repository 
 Regularly perform self-check of work products to eliminate repeat errors and demonstrate continuous improvement in work products continuously 
 Translate and synthesize information into deliverables that targeted audiences can understand, while maintaining the technical accuracy and completeness of the intended response 
 Maintain quality results by using templates; following writing standards including readability, consistency, and tone 
 Exhibit a very organized approached and superior attention to details 
 Able to take on new tasks and responsibilities as needed 
 Perform other work-related duties as assigned by management 
 
 Qualifications 
 
 Bachelors’ degree in related field or discipline 
 Must have proven working experience in business analysis, writing and project management 
 Minimum of 3-5 years of experience and a demonstrated track record of accomplishments 
 3-5 years of the following experience: 
 Translating and synthesizing information into effective business documents 
 Analyzing various business products and services 
 Coordinating deliverable development 
 Applying layout and other desktop publishing skills 
 Developing tools and templates 
 Editing content for clarification and consistency 
 Project management and schedule development 
 Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem-solving skills 
 Demonstrate a high degree of productivity while handling multiple tasks simultaneously 
 Ability to perform comfortably in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented work environment

  Schneider Electric has an opportunity for a  Business Analyst/Project Leader  in our  Energy and Sustainability Services group. 
 
 
  What will you do?  
 
 
 Partner with business sponsors, subject matter experts, and software development teams to build and enhance business process and reporting software 
  Work with product management and business stakeholder analysis teams to develop technology solutions to business needs 
  Elicit, shape and document software development requirements while maintaining a strong functional knowledge of applications

  Create and maintain documentation of new project processes and deliverables including requirements, testing documentation and issues logs 
  Roll out new system enhancements to system users meeting training needs 
 
 
  What qualifications will make you successful?  
 
 
 5+ years’ experience  as business analyst working on customer-facing business applications that are  both data heavy  and  customer-focused 
  Strong attention to detail and analytical skills with core competency in thoroughly understanding the entirety of problems and solutions 
  Creativity to view a problem from many angles, problem solve and drive towards an excellent solution 
  Initiative to uncover and solve problems proactively and self-starter who can suggest technology improvements 
  Effective working on teams, within and outside of function

  Ability to effectively multi-task and manage priorities 
  Proficiency in a MS Windows environment (i.e. Word & Excel) 
  Bachelor's degree from accredited college/university 
  Strong experience with project management methodologies

  Qualifications:

  Schneider Electric offers a robust benefits package to support our employees such as flexible work arrangements, paid family leave, 401(k)+ match, and more. Click here to find out more about working with us: http://se.com/us/careers.
  
 
 
  Let us learn about you! Apply today. 
 
 
  About Our Company: 
  
  Why us? 
 
 
   Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

98ce79de57a772fa.title: Business Analyst (GIS)
98ce79de57a772fa.desc:
Description   We're powering a cleaner, brighter future.
  
  Exelon is leading the energy transformation, and we're calling all problem solvers, innovators, community builders and change makers. Work with us to deliver solutions that make our diverse cities and communities stronger, healthier and more resilient.
  
  We're powered by purpose-driven people like you who believe in being inclusive and creative, and value safety, innovation, integrity and community service. We are a Fortune 200 company, 19,000 colleagues strong serving more than 10 million customers at six energy companies - Atlantic City Electric (ACE), Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE), Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), Delmarva Power & Light (DPL), PECO Energy Company (PECO), and Potomac Electric Power Company (Pepco).
  
  In our relentless pursuit of excellence, we elevate diverse voices, fresh perspectives and bold thinking. And since we know transforming the future of energy is hard work, we provide competitive compensation, incentives, excellent benefits and the opportunity to build a rewarding career.
  
  Are you in?
  
 
 PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION 
  Perform general analysis and prepare reports to support business operations. Conduct modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, business case development, and other general financial and operational analysis. Monitor and coordinate activities to support operational performance management (e.g., safety, reliability, service level, productivity, etc.). Research and provide statistical financial and operational information. Track, maintain, analyze and provide current information on the operation's business scorecard or key performance indicators (KPIs). Develop and organize performance reports for both internal and external use. Contribute to the development of shortterm and long-range business planning. Provide analytical and operational support to the business unit. Position may be required to work extended hours for coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies.   
 
 PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES 
 
  Support and contribute to the development of short-term and long-range business planning. Conduct modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, business case development, and other financial and operational analysis (e.g., operational effectiveness, budget, resource, workload, workforce and capacity utilization, competitor, etc.). 
  Provide statistical information to ensure the most effective utilization of personnel, equipment and/or materials for business operations. 
  Monitor and coordinate activities to support operational performance management (e.g., safety, reliability, service level, productivity, etc.). 
  Track, maintain, analyze and provide current information on the operation's business scorecard or key performance indicators (KPIs). 
  Perform analysis of the operation's cost elements to ensure effective and efficient operations. 
  Prepare and analyze detailed standard and non-standard reports. 
  Develop, organize and present detailed performance reports for both internal and external use. 
  Provide analytical and operational support to the business unit. 
 
 
  JOB SCOPE 
 
  This is an individual contributor position that works under general supervision and frequently performs non-routine work. This position is expected to resolve most questions and problems through interaction with internal and/or external stakeholders, executives, directors, managers, and staff across the organization, and refers only the most complex issues to higher levels. On occasion, may mentor less experienced colleagues.  
 May require working extended hours and/or shift work to support business operations.  
 
 Qualifications   
 MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 
 
  Bachelor's degree in Business or Engineering AND 2 - 4 years related business experience, or in lieu of Bachelor's degree, a minimum of 3 - 6 years relevant business experience is required. 
  General understanding of applicable standards, methods, processes and practices, business fundamentals, and performance metrics in the specific functional area supported by this position (e.g., asset management, electric or gas operations, customer service, transmission and substation, distribution system operations, regulatory and external affairs, transmission operations and planning). 
  General proficiency in standard software applications (e.g., Windows10, OneDrive, SharePoint & SharePoint Forms, SharePoint Designer, Access DB, PowerPoint, PowerBI, Adobe, Visio, Project etc...), and specialized Mobile Enterprise business technologies and applications (e.g., Ventyx-Asset Suite, ABB Outage Management System, SCADA, Computer Aided Drafting, Computerized Dispatching tools) to retrieve and analyze data in support of business needs. 
  Ability to provide general analysis and apply managerial accounting concepts, customer intelligence gathering, forecasting, staff planning, scheduling, analytical and statistical problem solving, financial, accounting, business and budget analysis. General analytical skills for project evaluation including analysis of projects with economic, financial, risk and decision analysis. 
  General analytical skills for project evaluation including analysis of projects with economic, financial, risk and decision analysis. Experience in business case development and ability to effectively present business cases to business unit leadership. 
  Customer driven with good oral and written communications skills and general analytical, problem solving and project management skills. 
  General knowledge of the practices, procedures and principles of performance analysis (trending, root cause and gap analysis) benchmarking and audit compliance. Ability to analyze organizational data and problems, interpret and recommend alternative courses of action, and implement intervention strategies to attain performance targets. 
 
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 
 
  Minimum of 2-year experience in GIS. Can be with in Gas or Electric Utility GIS mapping systems, such as SmallWorld GIS or ArcView GIS (ESRI).  
 Bachelor's degree in Business or Engineering AND 2 - 4 years related business experience, or in lieu of Bachelor's degree, a minimum of 3 - 6years relevant business experience is required.  
 Candidate can multi-task and can demonstrate excellent customer service while managing large inflows of requests.  
 Candidate should possess ability to communicate & provide customer support amongst multiple clients' needs.

e3997ba274a18f22.desc:
Synovize is a leading technology consulting firm that specializes in providing innovative solutions to businesses across various industries. With a team of experienced professionals, we aim to deliver exceptional services to our clients and help them achieve their digital transformation goals. As a remote-first company, we offer flexible work opportunities to talented individuals across the United States. 
 Overview: 
 We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced ServiceNow IT Service Management (ITSM) Analyst to join our team. As a ServiceNow ITSM Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing, designing, and implementing IT service management solutions using the ServiceNow platform. This is a full-time, permanent or contract position with the flexibility of remote work. 
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to understand their IT service management needs and translate them into ServiceNow configurations. 
 Analyze existing IT service management processes and workflows, identifying areas for improvement and optimization. 
 Design and configure ServiceNow ITSM modules, including incident management, problem management, change management, and service catalog. 
 Customize ServiceNow functionalities using JavaScript, Angular, and other web technologies to meet specific client requirements. 
 Integrate ServiceNow with external systems through REST API, SOAP API, and other integration methods. 
 Develop and maintain the Configuration Management Database (CMDB) to ensure accurate and up-to-date data. 
 Conduct testing and quality assurance activities to ensure the stability and reliability of the implemented ITSM solutions. 
 Provide end-user training and support during and after the implementation process. 
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery within agreed timelines and budgets. 
 Stay updated with the latest ServiceNow features and enhancements, recommending and implementing improvements to optimize IT service management processes. 
 
 Requirements: 
 
 Proven experience as a ServiceNow ITSM Analyst, working on IT service management projects and configuring the ServiceNow platform. 
 Strong knowledge of IT service management processes and frameworks, such as ITIL. 
 Proficiency in JavaScript, Angular, and web technologies for customization and enhancement purposes. 
 Experience with integrating ServiceNow with external systems using REST API, SOAP API, and other methods. 
 Familiarity with the Configuration Management Database (CMDB) and data management best practices. 
 Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into technical solutions. 
 Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with clients and cross-functional teams. 
 
 Preferred Skills: 
 
 ServiceNow certifications such as Certified Implementation Specialist or Certified Application Developer. 
 Knowledge of ITIL best practices and their application in ServiceNow. 
 Experience with other ServiceNow modules such as GRC, HAM, SAM, APM, and SPM. 
 Familiarity with NoSQL databases and their usage in ServiceNow. 
 Experience with ITOM, SCCM, JAMF, or other related tools and technologies. 
 
 To apply for the position of ServiceNow IT Service Management (ITSM) Analyst at Synovize, please submit your resume and any relevant certifications. We are excited to hear from talented individuals who are passionate about leveraging the power of ServiceNow to drive efficient IT service delivery. Join us in shaping the future of technology consulting!

da57dce95e6d560b.title: HEALTHCARE INFORMATION SECURITY ANALYST, SR
da57dce95e6d560b.desc:
HEALTHCARE INFORMATION SECURITY ANALYST, SR 
 
 23003357 
 
 
 
  Job 
 :  Information Technology
  
 
  Primary Location 
 :  Columbia
  
 
  Schedule 
 :  Full-time
  
 
  Shift 
 :  Day Job
  
 
  Unposting Date 
 :  Ongoing
  
 
  Description 
 
  Shift:  Monday – Friday, 8:00AM – 5:00PM 
  Location:  Remote (Missouri Preferred) 
  Department:  IT Administration 
  Salary Range:  $78,520 - $127,962 
  Job Summary: 
  Responsible for assisting in the development, implementation, and monitoring of tools and processes that protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all MU Health information technology (IT) systems and infrastructure. Maintain compliance with all relevant laws and policies. Perform complex and non-routine specialized security analysis functions and advanced analysis. 
  Job Description: 
  Work within the framework of established security and compliance policies and procedures. 
  Develop and maintain information security policies, procedures, and standards, to ensure they meet regulatory compliance and are aligned with industry best practice. Ensure compliance with relevant information security policies, laws, and standards. Identify areas for improvement and work to implement necessary changes. Develop and deliver information security and HIPAA compliance training to all MU Health employees. Administer tailored security training to business owners, data owners, application administrators, and technical staff. 
  Coordinate and conduct vulnerability scans of MU Health Information Systems, including vendors. Analyze data and identify solutions for vulnerability remediation. 
  Maintain informed awareness of security compromises through all stages; means of entry, effects on systems, plan for prevention, and preparation for recovery. Maintain risk register to track current and emerging risks. Perform risk assessments as part of the MU Health risk management lifecycle on current, critical MU Health information systems, identifying gaps and maintaining updates to the MU Health Information Security Corrective Action Plans. Maintain vendor, solution, and data inventories. Audit and maintain documentation related to evaluations, assessments, and remediation. 
  Coordinate and test against adopted security control framework on MU Health information systems, identifying gaps and documenting corrective actions until control-failures are mitigated. 
  May complete unit/department specific duties as outlined in department documents. 
  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES 
  Knowledge of healthcare information and systems. 
  Knowledge of the HIPAA Security Rule. 
  Understanding of information security practices for the network, servers, databases, applications, and advanced use of information security assessment and risk management techniques. 
  Experience in vulnerability management. 
  Experience monitoring data loss and prevention solutions. 
  Experience in IT auditing or IT risk governance/ compliance. 
 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications 
 
  Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, information security, or related area, or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities can be acquired. 
  Five (5) years of experience in information technology, or two (2) years of experience in information security. 
  One of the following certifications within one (1) year as a condition of continued employment in this job classification: 
 
 -Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) by ISC2 
 
 
 -Health Care Information Systems Security and Privacy Practitioner (HCISPP) by ISC2 
 
 
 -Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) by ISACA 
 
 
 -or equivalent certification. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  We value the uniqueness of every individual and strive to ensure each person’s success. Contributions from individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives promote intellectual pluralism and enable us to achieve the excellence that we seek in learning, research and engagement. This commitment makes our university a better place to work, learn and innovate.

7d290baf7e119df3.title: Business Analyst (USDA-FS)
7d290baf7e119df3.desc:
Founded in 2003, IT Concepts’ core values – customer-centricity, teamwork, driven to deliver, innovation, and integrity – ensure we work together to be the best, realize objectives, and make a positive impact in our communities. We intentionally created and sustain our ITC culture that embraces change, experimentation, continuous learning, and improvement. We bring our design thinking problem solving approach that challenges assumptions, prioritizes curiosity, and invites complexity to deliver innovative, efficient, and effective solutions. As we continue to grow in the support of our government customers, we are looking for driven and innovative individuals to join our team. 
  IT Concepts is seeking to hire a qualified Business Analyst to support our USDA Forest Service customer. The Salesforce platform and application software development will support the Forest Service Human Resources Enterprise Solution (HRES) leadership with a unified tool that uses organizational management to plan and hire, using a structured approach based on key priority employee positions and needs. As a Business Analyst you will be part of a team helping Forest Service achieve mission-driven success. Current organizational management data exist in disparate systems (Access, Excel, SharePoint, NFC, EmpowHR, AgLearn, Performance Management System, BudgetManagement System, etc.). The solution to be configured must consider data integration and consolidation to avoid multiple manual entries and/or data duplication.. 
  Responsibilities: 
 
  Collaborate with stakeholders and the development team, analyzing business and user needs to capture and refine system requirements and develop user stories  
 
 
 Collaborate with stakeholders and team members to provide system requirement refinement, user story confirmation 
 Conduct current state assessment of position management processes and technology sources detailing the steps through process mapping for creating and approving a new position, modifying a position, and rendering a position inactive 
 Conduct Human Centered Design (HCD) on processes across stakeholders to inform the user experience and design across various business users of the tool 
 Translate business requirements into solutions in the Salesforce environment. 
 Understand the impacts of business requirements on the configuration, processes, and workflows within Salesforce.  
 Collaborate on UAT test scenarios, developing test scripts, UI/UX testing (as needed) and conducting testing and verification exercises.  
 Work alongside a team of Analysts, Business stakeholders and developers to deliver Agile solutions. 
 
 Location : Employee should be within commuting distance to DC area for potential site visits. The majority of position is telework. 
  Requirements 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology or related field  
 Experience supporting Salesforce platform and application development efforts for federal government.  
 2+ years of experience with requirements analysis, solutioning, functional/technical design documentation, and training 
    
 2+ years of Salesforce Business Analyst experience, providing functional support for the development of Salesforce applications.  
 Experience using common enterprise agile planning tools, such as Jira.  
 Proven experience working in Agile/Scrum development methodologies.  
 Strong ability to guide and work with cross-functional teams.  
 Experience supporting federal IT projects.  
 
 
 Excellent at identifying and solving problems.  
 Must be a U.S Citizen  
 
 
 Preferred :  
 
 Trailhead Certifications:
    
 Salesforce Business Analyst; or 
 Salesforce Certified Administrator 
 
 Experience being part of Salesforce implementations 
 
 Clearance:  
 
 Must be able to complete Public Trust Suitability process 
 
  Benefits 
  The Company   
 We believe in generating success collaboratively, enabling long-term mission success, and building trust for the next challenge. With you as our partner, let’s solve challenges, think innovatively, and maximize impact. As a valued member of our ITC community, you have the unique opportunity to work in a diverse range of technology and business career paths, all while supporting our nation and delivering innovative technology solutions. We are a close community of experts that pride ourselves on creating an environment defined by teamwork, dedication, and excellence.  
 We hold three ISO certifications (27001:2013, 20000-1:2011, 9001:2015) and two CMMI ML 3 ratings (DEV and SVC).  
 Industry Recognition   
 Growth | Inc 5000’s Fastest Growing Private Companies, DC Metro List Fastest Growing; Washington Business Journal: Fastest Growing Companies, Top Performing Small Technology Companies in Greater D.C.  
 Culture | Northern Virginia Technology Council Tech 100 Honoree; Virginia Best Place to Work; Washington Business Journal: Best Places to Work, Corporate Diversity Index Winner – Mid-Size Companies, Companies Owned by People of Color; Department of Labor’s HireVets for our work helping veterans transition; SECAF Award of Excellence finalist; Victory Military Friendly Brand; Virginia Values Veterans (V3); Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Corporate Breath Award  
 Benefits   
 We offer great benefits – Competitive Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Identity Theft Protection, Legal Resources Coverage, 401(k) with company matching with NO vesting period. ITC Health benefits have $0 premium for certain plans as an employee.  
 We invest in our employees – Every employee is eligible for education reimbursement for certifications, degrees, or professional development. Reimbursement amount may fluctuate due to IRS limitations. We want you to grow as an expert and a leader and offer flexibility for you to take a course, complete a certification, or other professional growth and networking. We are committed to supporting your curiosity and sustaining a culture that prioritizes commitment to continuous professional development.  
 We work hard, we play hard. ITC is committed to incorporating fun into every day. We dedicate funds for activities – virtual and in-person – e.g., we have free tickets to Nationals games available upon employee request; we host happy hours, holiday events, fitness events, and annual celebrations. In alignment with our commitment to our communities, we host and attend charity galas/events. We believe in appreciating your commitment and building a positive workspace for you to be creative, innovative, and happy.  
 AAEO & VEVRAA   
 IT Concepts is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer and a VEVRAA (Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act) Federal Contractor. As such, any personnel decisions (hire, promotion, job status, etc.) on applicants and/or employees are based on merit, qualifications, competence and business needs, not on race, color, citizenship status, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, genetic information of the employee or family member of the employee, marital status, veteran status, political affiliation, or any other factor protected by federal, state or local law.  
 IT Concepts maintains a strong commitment to compliance with VEVRAA and other applicable federal, state, and local laws governing equal employment opportunity. We have developed comprehensive policies and procedures to ensure that our hiring practices align with these requirements.  
 As a part of our VEVRAA compliance efforts, [Company Name] has established an affirmative action plan that outlines our commitment to the recruitment, hiring, and advancement of protected veterans. This plan is regularly reviewed and updated to ensure its effectiveness.

You must submit the application for IT Concepts to receive. If you need alternative application methods, please email careers@useitc.com and request assistance.
